Posts.Content: Mar 7, 2009 06:05PM jrb wrote: Suze, I'll compete with you for complications from mast/recon!  I hate to think I may 'win" the contest.  Really, the "win" is healing... After my 2nd implant (the first was too high...my boob was at my collarbone) I developed either a "clear infection" or cellulitis.  Implant removed and area was packed 2xday with gauze to let it heal from inside-out for almost 2 mths.  My chest looks like a battleground, but is finally clear of infection and healed. Frustrating to think I did reconstruction to avoid wearing a prosthesis (which I hate).  If your problem isn't resolved yet, keep lobbying for yourself, if we don't do it no one else will' Judy
Posts.Title: Heat spreading from chest to back Suze donsuzbee

Posts.Content: jrb wrote: I was diagnosed with breast ca in 2000.  After surgery, chemo and radiation, and reconstruction with multiple side effects, I now have metastic breast cancer of the nodes in my neck.  After a second round of radiation to the neck area, I developed lymphedema in my neck.  I have swelling and redness,,,feels like a BAD sunburn.  I am taking neurontin for the nerve pain, but unlike lymphedema of the arm, compression is not an option.  Has anyone experienced this and any suggestions for reducing the swelling?  I never thought of lymphedema any place other than arm...who would have thought! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: lymphedema of the neck jrb jrb

Posts.Content: Mar 7, 2009 05:15PM jrb wrote: Binney4, Thanks for the suggestions...I'll see if I can find a MLD therapist in my area!  Checking the web sites, too.  jrb
